item.title: The Moon #2
item.dc:creator: Minimalio
item.content:encoded:
Photographic Chart of the Moon, plate 2

Medium

photogravure with ink on tissue paper overlay

Dimensions

image: 31.1 × 25.5 cm (12 1/4 × 10 1/16 in.)
plate: 38.9 × 29.5 cm (15 5/16 × 11 5/8 in.)
sheet: 49 × 37.9 cm (19 5/16 × 14 15/16 in.)
tissue: 42.55 × 37.47 cm (16 3/4 × 14 3/4 in.)

item.title: Exhibitions
item.dc:creator: Minimalio
item.content:encoded:
1900 - "Celestial Mechanics and the New Century" - Palais des Sciences, Paris
1901 - "Observations of the Transit of Mercury" - Observatoire de Lyon
1903 - "Stellar Photography: Capturing the Night Sky" - Société Astronomique de France, Paris
1904 - "The Moons of Jupiter: A Photographic Study" - Institut de France
1906 - "Cometary Orbits and Celestial Prediction" - Académie des Sciences, Paris
1907 - "Solar Eclipse Observations from Algeria" - Musée d'Histoire Naturelle, Paris
1909 - "Variable Stars of the Southern Hemisphere" - Observatoire de Nice
1911 - "Nebulae Classifications: New Discoveries" - Royal Astronomical Society, London
1912 - "Asteroid Belt Mapping Project" - Sorbonne, Paris
1914 - "War Time Astronomy: Maintaining Science" - Observatoire de Strasbourg
1916 - "Double Star Systems and Orbital Mechanics" - Académie de Bordeaux
1918 - "Post-War Astronomical Reconstruction" - Observatoire de Paris
1920 - "Einstein's Relativity and Stellar Observations" - École Normale Supérieure
1922 - "The Great Andromeda Nebula Controversy" - Institut Astrophysique, Paris
1924 - "Planetary Atmospheres: Spectroscopic Analysis" - Observatoire de Meudon
1926 - "Twenty-Five Years of Celestial Photography" - Galerie Scientifique, Paris
1928 - "The Expanding Universe: New Evidence" - Collège de France
1930 - "Search for Trans-Neptunian Objects" - Observatoire de Toulouse
1931 - "Radio Waves from Space: A New Frontier" - Institut de Physique, Paris
1932 - "A Career in Astronomy: Retrospective Exhibition" - Musée des Arts et Métiers, Paris

item.title: Biography
item.dc:creator: Minimalio
item.content:encoded:
Charles Le Morvan

1865 - 1933

Charles Le Morvan (1865-1933) was a French astronomer and photographer who specialized in lunar photography. His work, such as "Carte Photographique de la Lune," are detailed, high-resolution images of the Moon's surface, providing a comprehensive and scientific view of its craters, mountains, and seas. His photographic maps of the Moon were significant contributions to the field of astronomy and are valuable resources for lunar scientists and enthusiasts alike.
